page.title: 01EAST KILBRIDE AND DISTRICT
page.content: {EAST KILBRIDE AND DISTRICT EAST KILBRIDE is in{STRATHCLYDE REGION and lies 8 miles south of {GLASGOW}.It is SCOTLAND'S{SIXTH}largest town and has been planned and built around a village of 2400 inhabitants by a {DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION,}appointed by the Secretary of State for SCOTLAND in 1947.The population is now about 75000 Our specific block lies to the N.E. of the town centre and is linked to the neighbouring town of Hamilton and M74 by a new Expressway built with funds from the{E.E.C.}Half of our area is residential and half farmland with the {Calderglen Country Park}bridging the gap between the two.The Rotten Calder river flows through the park and later joins the famous River Clyde. A profitable community of industry and housing,shops and offices,schools and social amenities has now developed.
